Reviews.Title: “Recommended budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris A Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not much to complain about this hotel. Staff very friendly and hotel and room very clean. Excellent location. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap in the right place”
Reviews.Author: ACRStockholm
Reviews.Content: A good place to sleep for a very deasent price. Modernaized building with elevator. Close to las Ramblas and also the surroundings in Barrio Vela with restaurants and tapasbars that doesn´t cost to much even, on the street las Ramblas. Don´t order anything from the cafés or bars with tables on the Rambla, prices are scandalous and so are the waiters.

Reviews.Title: “One Block off Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: This is def a travelers hotel @ one star. I booked this for a solo stay for 2 nights in Barcelona. If you are budget minded it will fit the bill. The hotel is small & the door and sign are easy to miss. Reception area is nice and the hotel felt very secure. Staff was very friendly and spoke English well. Free Wifi and a PC to use as well on 2nd floor. It is one block off Las Ramblas a little hidden, but once you find your wat there, it is always very easy to find your way back. Las Ramblas is def the main strip! Once you are at the hotel everything is right there in walking distance, The Gothic quarter, the waterfront etc. The Metro is also right there. My room was very small with a window w/view of wall. No AC, so i imagine it would be very hot in summer. Also there is no food or drink of any type, but... there are places to eat everywhere just steps from the front door. My room was clean, but dated. Overall the location is just awesome! But it is a one star hotel, barebones, but clean and secure. Get on the Metro, take L3 to stop Liceu, the hotel says stop Catalunya, but that is about 3 blocks away, Liceu is only 50 meters to hotels front door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ok-59
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Ingles with my wife (a couple in 50´s) for 4 nights in October 2011. The location is perfect for a vacation in Barcelona. Hotel is small and cozy, staff is helpful and spoke english well enough, and though they didn't serve breakfast, there are lots of good cafes to choose from in the neighborhood. The only problem is the noice from the street, which was loud. First crowd brom the bars, then carbage trucks etc. But if you can have a room away from the street, or are a good sleeper, or wear earplugs, then it should be fine. Anyhow, we liked hotel Ingles, there was something sympatetic about it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant budget hotel in ideal location with friendly/helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Racheybabes31
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here for 7 nights from 09/10/11 to 16/10/11. The hotel is a 30 second walk from Liceu metro station right next to Las Ramblas. It is a busy area but we weren't bothered by street noise at all (although there is a church tower bell that chimes every quarter of an hour but it's not too bad!!!!). The room was perfect for us - a budget hotel but bed was comfy, a wardrobe, bedside cabinets, fan, safe (have to pay extra), and the shower was powerful and hot! Also got provided with shampoo sachets and soap. Cleaned everyday. Staff at the reception were very friendly and more than willing to help if you had any questions, one member of staff recommended a tapas bar off the beaten track and it was the tastiest food ever and we got a free glass of cava because we said the hotel had recommended them!! All in all I would definitely recommend this place as an ideal place to stay if you're sight seeing in Barcelona on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Hotel Inglés, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: BmthTraveller
Reviews.Content: Booked via booking.com as we usually do, surprised to find that this hotel took payment immediately instead of using card number to secure the booking, then paying during the stay. Hotel is excellently located for La Rambla and the gothic quarter which is why we chose it. Am now aware that the city was probably fully booked for its Fiesta Mercé BUT the room we were given was pretty dreadful. Situated in the middle of the hotel, its only 'window' looked out on to a small shaft which gave little natural light and no air. Room had no AC (which we knew) but did have a fan which only blew the hot air around and would have been OK if we had access to fresh air. Believe the room was actually a single (as the room next door was) with a small double, uncomfortable, bed in it. Room was kept clean but was very tired. Other reviews had cited hotel as a bit noisy but wasn't worried about this as it is in the heart of a busy nightlife city so goes with the territory. Saw other rooms which were bigger and opened out to the front (noise at night) or rear (church clock chiming every hour) but this would have been immensely preferable to the airless, dark cramped space we were given. Would not book this hotel again for fear of being given a middle room again. Had they not already taken payment we may have looked around for another place to stay. On the PLUS side, the reception staff were very friendly and helpful and the rooms have a safe at only 2 euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: apaniccia
Reviews.Content: I was there in July 2011 , Great Location , no more than 50 feet away from Las Ramblas, not much space I must say compared to american or south american hotels, staff members were very friendly, clean , secure door men 24 hrs , free computer use in the lobby at 2nd floor, free wifi, breakfast included... I would definitely come back...

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise - great location”
Reviews.Author: Cucuchi
Reviews.Content: I was not too sure about making a reservation at this hotel, but after reading reviews on this site, I decided to go for it, I have to say I was a little bit nervous! I am glad I stayed here, location is great, rooms are very clean, not too small like other hostals, there is not air conditioning but THERE IS A FAN in the room! we got a room in the back, no view but was very quiet! the front desk staff was very helpful and pleasant! The free WIFI in the room worked all the time, and there was a telephone in our room, which was great! Would recommend this hostal! Tips: I picked up a brochure in this hostal, it was a Flamenco show, I have to say, it was excellent! the best I have seen in Barcelona ( I saw 3 shows) This shows cost only 13 euros including a glass of sangria and is only 45 minutes long, but the dancers are superb! was at Stokes Bar, but I guess you can buy your tickets at Tarantinos in the Plaza Real where the shows is!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, good location, clean.”
Reviews.Author: Butterflecca
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very ideal if you are on a budget and for very good location. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The rooms are always clean and tidy. The only negative was that the room is without AC and the fan is not very powerful. This gets to be quite uncomfortable in summer.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money considering the location.”
Reviews.Author: firefoxphoenix
Reviews.Content: Occupying a single room means your never going to get the most luxurious of accomodation but the selling pionts of this one star hotel is its location and price. there is a bell that tolls every half hour but at a budget hotel your not going to spend much time in the room looking at the walls. Saying that there were a lot of noises going on ( i think i had the room outide the broom cupboard!) so id take some earplugs if your a light sleeper. The room was clean and tidy and is fantastically located half way up Las Rambas just on the Gothic quater side (the good side). The staff do speak English but not fantasticaly fluent, i had no cause to raise any issues and the guy on night duty was very helpful when advising me not to walk to the bus station at 5a.m. Dont book this hotel if your looking for secret luxury or are really fussy on detail like wonky light switches and fuzzy spanish tv channels. Do book this hotel if you want a place to dump your stuff, have a good shower and see more of Barcelona than a hotel room. I visited in April/May and the weather was perfect, not too hot. There is no airconditioning so i could possibly imagine the rooms would get quite stuffy in the high season. Last thing...Stay away from Las Ramblas at night. I had three attempted pickpockets (look out for flyer touts trying to play act a footballing move on you, they will be lifting your wallet from your pocket!) Its a shoe hole anyway, theres only tatt, rubbish restaurants and caricaturists. Do all the culture, art, architecture, beach, port and stuff you know you really want to instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean and not so expensive”
Reviews.Author: Alieberm
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is at excellent location. The Hotel staff is nice. We've left early in mornings and came back late at the evenings to a clean room (the room was clean, the towels were replaced) and comfortable beds. And, because its location no problem to go out again to restaurant, pub, whatever. There is a free WiFi (at the upper floors (4) the reception is not so good. The back rooms are very quite. The back rooms are very quite (ask for them.) The room is very basic. TV only Spanish channels. For the ones who plan a trip during the summer (we were there during March), note, there is no Air-conditioner in the room. At the upper floors (3-4) the WiFi reception is not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Vigie0
Reviews.Content: Based on other Trip Advisor reviews we requested rooms in the back which worked out nicely for us. The triple we had was spacious with a terrace. The double we had later was a bit smaller but equally clean with a large window and balconette. I would say, though that I travel with earl plugs. I slept beautifully and only noticed the bells from the near-by church when I was awake. The beds were firm and twin in size. The attached bathrooms had good water pressure. It is a no frills, clean hotel, in a nice location. The staff at the front were very helpful and even provided some good eating recommendations. Oh and they have free wifi! Life saver for me. Note that the street is pedestrian only so the taxi can not take you right up to it. They have to drop you off at Las Ramblas and you walk down the street to the hotel. There are normally taxis available at all the hours but you can ask the front desk to call a radio taxi if you want to be sure. Just note that radio-taxis are a bit more expensive than the ones you flag down on your own. Example: Airport to Hotel about 25 Euros regular taxi. Hotel to Airport with radio taxi was more like 40 Euros granted we tipped for our heavy bags but you get the idea.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, low priced, clean & excellently located. Ideal for single traveller”
Reviews.Author: Wildeydude
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find a cheap hotel near or on las ramblas. I tried a few on the main street but they were between €70 & €150 then I found hotel ingles. Walked in, asked the price €30. Sorted. Free wifi in the room. Room 206. Small bathroom but adequate. Clean comfy bed. Pleasant staff. Would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: MsZaDu
Reviews.Content: I have never travelled alone before, so I never gave it a thought of how it may influence on the roomsize ;-) From now on, i definitely stay in doublerooms! I was quite chocked when i saw my room, OMG it was small! Clean though, and kind of cosy in a spanish way, but small. Too small. When all that is said - it was a great hotel! The location is perfect, excellent, wonderful, great! 5 meters to the Rambla, Bouquria Market, Starbucks (neeeeed my coffee☺) and right in the center of the Gothic Quater, just around the corner of the Barcelona Cathedral, Placa de Catalunya - actually just around the corner of everything! So if you just need a bed and a shower in the middle of everything, this is the place to stay! (in a doubleroom☺)

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel with friendly staff in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny_scfr
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely friendly and the hotel was very well situated (30m from metro, 20 from las ramblas). However, the room was more reminiscent of a single in a hostel than a hotel- the tiles in the bathroom were cracked and mismatched. The furniture was all rickety and mismatched, and the bed had a distinctly camp/ dorm bed feel to it! On the other hand the room was always cleaned immaculately, so if you just want somewhere quiet and clean to sleep in between sightseeing I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: littlemiss009
Reviews.Content: This is in such a good location, though initially a bit tricky to find especially when we were pulling our sutcases down rambles searching! Loved the location, and really made the most of our short stay by being so close into the action. There was internet access in the room, and the room was comfortable, the bathroom small but ok. This was a lot better than I expected in this price range. The only thing was there was no airconditioning. This meant we had to leave the door open, and while it was lovely having a balcony room during the day, we coud here everything at night. I am a very deep sleeper and it takes a lot to wake me, but this sure did. Despite some of the drawbacks, I would definitely stay here again to have the chance to be so close for a small cost.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: repetitor
Reviews.Content: Last time I was in Barcelona was in 1995, and I didn't have to pay for a hotel. So I don't have any reference. The hotel is located in a street next to La Rambla and the Boqueria market. It's close to the Barrio Gotic and Borne. The places to shop, eat and party. Also not to far from the seafront and Beach. Location, location, location. Now, the hotel: Very friendly staff, with basic knowledge of English. My lady speaks Spanisch (Castiliano), so that was not a problem. We had a room on the street side, but asked to be moved. The pubs and restaurants provide a lot of noise. Also the garbage collection during night time are annoying. We couldn't get a new room right away, because the hotel was full. On the third day of our stay, we could pack our bags and our luggage was moved to another room. Great service!!! The rooms were big enough. Bathroom also, but not very handy. Hotel was clean and the room was cleaned every day. Towels changed every day. We didn't make reservations for breakfast, and you shouldn't. You can get breakfast everywhere. The hotel breakfast is in the Tapes Gaudi restaurant next door. I saw the leftovers from one table being moved to another table by the waitress, I think this is a NOGO. At least they could keep up apperances and take the leftovers back to the kitchen. At another occasion I got a plate with the breadcrumbs of the previous customer on it. Shame, because the food was good. But it's not becuase we're tourist you have to treat us like fools. Why the mixed feelings? We payed an average of 100€ per day. For a few euro's more we could have stayed in an aparthotel. If this was Paris, it would have been good. But Barcelona is not Paris. If we go back to Barcelona, we'll look for a cheaper hotel, a little further of the city centre. Barcelona Metro is great, Borne and Barcelonetta are more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Just 10 metres to Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: cgiderler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Hostel has a perfect location. Just 15 metres las ramblas and 20 metres to metro station. But you won't need the metro:) You can go the main places by walk about 5-15 minutes. Stuff was friendly; can speak english. Rooms are acceptable and also clean. We stayed in the rooms at the 2,3 and 4 floor an all rooms were quiet. Free breakfast in the bar next to hotel was good. Also there was a free wifi in the rooms and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones hotel-"lite" in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: smscot
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Ingles for two nights and found the hotel satisfactory (neither great, nor downright horrible). As other reviewers have mentioned, the location is absolutely ideal, though a bit hard to locate at first because of its position sandwiched between tapas bars on a tiny street. That being said, I didn't find the reception staff particularly helpful (language-wise, they spoke very little English and friendliness-wise, I didn't find them eager to help), and I think that the room rate is a bit high given the bare-bones quality (I had a very tiny room with a small TV, small bathroom, and a non-functioning wireless signal). Overall, if you are looking for a clean, safe place to stay -- and really do want to stay in the heart of the city -- Hotel Ingles is perfect. Don't expect anything more than bare-bones, however; I have stayed in many hotels and hostels while traveling throughout Europe and would say that Hotel Ingles, despite its having private rooms, really is equal if not less than top-quality hostels I've stayed in in terms of amenities provided. One last caution: Hotel seems to have strange policy of making guests leave room keys at reception while out for the day, only to pick them up when they come back in the evening. I was told this is a matter of "control"; however, I have NEVER been to a hotel with this policy, and no other reviewers have mentioned it. I find this whole proposition very strange, and it makes me question the credibility of the hotel on a whole. Very, very odd.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: KushanMitra
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are extremely basic, the Wi-Fi signal is a bit patchy on the 3rd and 4th floors and the lift can be noisy but you just can't fault the hotel for its location and the very reasonable rates. You are located very close to the Liceu Metro station on the Ramblas and the Placa Catalunya is only a five-seven minute walk, and you are literally in the Barri Gotic. As for food, skip the brekker and eat on the road!

Reviews.Title: “clean, great location, free wi-fi... just don't try to cancel or change reservation”
Reviews.Author: britsprout
Reviews.Content: other reviewers have mentioned problems with the wi-fi so perhaps we got lucky or this has been fixed. we stayed in room 307, 3rd floor out of 4, facing the back of a church. this particular room was fairly big, super quiet (no street noise), had excellent wi-fi connection, tv, and large balcony (which we used as a fridge since it was so cold). the church does ring the bells every 15 minutes during the daytime, but this stops at 10 pm i believe and doesn't start before 8 or 9 am. it seemed like the ceiling and walls between rooms were well insulated because i never heard any of the other tenants except for when they were walking through the halls. we stayed 5 nights total, and the hotel was fully booked 2 of the nights, but i still never heard any of our neighbors. basically, for a clean, no-frills hotel in a great location, it can't be beat. it's walking distance from a lot of great restaurants and less than a block from the nearest metro station (liceu). however, a word of warning: they will not change your reservations whatsoever. if reserving through booking.com, they charge your card right then and there and will absolutely not refund, credit, or transfer your dates. my husband unfortunately broke his arm badly a few weeks prior to our trip, and i begged them to let us move the dates or at least give us some credit to use later; booking.com even called on my behalf and also got nowhere. we offered to send a doctor's note as well, but they wouldn't budge. i understand if that is their policy, but it still sucked how inflexible they were. i know of other hotels that will make exceptions for medical issues and things like that. so just know that once you book, you absolutely cannot back out. in the end, we decided to go ahead with the trip and took it very slowly (lots of breaks/naps in our room). and i have to say at least the room was comfortable enough that we didn't mind spending so much time in it. but they only run the heat at night so be sure to request extra blankets if you're planning to hang out in your room during the day (like we did).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet or cool (take your pick)”
Reviews.Author: Lecaa
Reviews.Content: Perfect location...Gothic Quarter, Rambla, Boqueria Market and the Metro on the doorstep. Balcony over the street (as we requested). 'Party Central' outside all night, but new windows deadened the sound pretty well. Room was basic and clean; cheap for such a great location. Staff was friendly. SO..here's the rub: No air conditioning!! To be cool we had to leave those sound-muffling windows open! The choice was EITHER 'cool and noisy' OR 'hot and quiet' but never 'cool and quiet'. We fluctuated...4 mini-sleeps a night was the rule! Regardless, we had an incredible vacation and the night heat was soon forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option”
Reviews.Author: WhyWeTravel
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with other reviews, you get a good value for the money. The room was regular size, the bathroom was very clean, nothing looked run down as you would expect in low budget hotels. My room was facing the back/ church, there was some construction going on but with closed windows not bad at all. The only complain was the noise coming from the hall. The door/ wall separating the room from the hall was very thin, you can hear the cleaning lady getting ready in the morning and anybody walking by. Beds are small in Europe, I wouldn't put that in the 'complain' list. Breakfast was not included but there are plenty of options around. Try the La Boquaria Market, get your coffee and pastry/ sandwich while watching the colorful busy market life. Found some good restaurants behind the Market. The Metro is conveniently located half a block from the hotel. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “The internet didn't work”
Reviews.Author: ventoboy30
Reviews.Content: ... and it was only that they needed to reset the router - a very simple operation, but the desk clerk didn't know what a router was. Fortunately, there was a cheap internet cafe just up the Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location, clean, but sometimes noisy”
Reviews.Author: RaquelPonsati
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 2 minutes walking from La Rambla and Mercado Boqueria, an wonderful location in Barcelona, close to the Barri Gotic and aside a metro station. It's possible to walk to many places of Barcelona, as the Plaza Catalunya, Plaza ESpanya and Passeig de Gràcia. Our window was to Calle Boqueria, a very nice narrow old street. The only problem is that sometimes there was noise from the teenagers going to discotheques, but it's the normal in this location. You should only avoid this hotel if you want silence. The room is very big, clean bedlinen and towels, and all of it in a 1 star hotel! Ther's many cafes, restaurants and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel in heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: 31songs
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Hotel Ingles and would recommend it to anyone looking for a basic but clean central location for a visit to the city. As already pointed out in the previous reviews, it is just off Las Rambles, about half way between Placa Catalunya and the harbour. This is a great spot as you are in walking distance of many of the main attractions, and there is also a underground station (Liceu) at the top of the street. The hotel itself appears to be just a doorway between two tapas bars, but it has quite a few rooms over several floors. It is basic, but our room was very spacious, with a reasonably sized en suite bathroom. All was clean and tidy, with fresh towels each day. Our room also had a small balcony. The street was noisy until quite late, but the double glazing of the windows drowned out most of this noise. There was no air-con - not a problem for us but I imagine would be an issue in the height of summer. The room also had a safe available (3E per night charge) which was really useful, especially as Barcelona has a bad press for pickpockets etc, so it was good not to have to carry everything round all the time. The hotel does not serve food, but there are many many places to eat, both for breakfast and dinner, in the surrounding area.Tip - Do try to eat off Las Ramblas, the quality of the food will be better and the price drastically reduced! The staff were helpful and friendly, and we were able to leave our cases when we checked out as our flight was not until late that evening. When we returned for the cases after a hot day sightseeing, we were even able to use their WC facilities to freshen up and change before heading to the airport, which was great. All in all a great little find for a cheap and cheerful break!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Siobhan_d13
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here with my boyfriend in February 09. Went on a budget and the hotel was only 150euro for the three nights. Very basic but comfortable - double bed with en-suite. Located just a few metres off La Ramblas on La Boqueria. Loads of attractions nearby. Receptionists very friendly and rooms were very clean. Not fancy at all but it did the job! We didn't spend much time in the room as there's just so much to do in Barcelona. Would definitely return here if we were to go back sightseeing again. Backpackers bar just a few metres on the same street that provided somewhere to have a few drinks with travellers.

HotelInfo.Name: Ingles
HotelInfo.Address: Boqueria 17, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
